eu.fbk.rdfpro

Class Ruleset

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.rdfpro.Ruleset

  • public final class Ruleset
extends Object
    A set of rules, with associated optional meta-vocabulary.

    • Method Detail

      • getRules

        public Set<Rule> getRules()
        Returns the rules in this ruleset.
        Returns:
        a set of rules sorted by phase index, fixpoint flag and rule URI.

public Rule getRule(org.openrdf.model.URI ruleID)

      • getMetaVocabularyTerms

        public Set<org.openrdf.model.URI> getMetaVocabularyTerms()
        Returns the meta-vocabulary terms associated to this ruleset.
        Returns:
        a set of term URIs, sorted by URI

      • isDeletePossible

        public boolean isDeletePossible()
        Returns true if the evaluation of the ruleset may cause some statements to be deleted. This happens if the ruleset contains at least a rule with a non-null DELETE expression.
        Returns:
        true, if statement deletion is possible with this ruleset

      • isInsertPossible

        public boolean isInsertPossible()
        Returs true if the evaluation of the ruleset may cause some statements to be inserted. This happens if the ruleset contains at least a rule with a non-null INSERT expression.
        Returns:
        true, if statement insertion is possible with this ruleset

      • isMatchable

        public boolean isMatchable(org.openrdf.model.Statement stmt)
        Returns true if the supplied statement can be matched by a pattern in a WHERE or DELETE expression of some rule in this ruleset. Matchable statements (as defined before) are able to affect the rule evaluation process, whereas non-matchable statements can be safely removed with no effect on rule evaluation (i.e., no effect on the sets of statements deleted or inserted by the engine where evaluating this ruleset on some input data).
        Parameters:
        stmt - the statement to test
        Returns:
        true, if the statement is matchable by some WHERE or DELETE rule expression

      • getABoxRuleset

        public Ruleset getABoxRuleset(QuadModel tboxData)
        Returns the ruleset with the ABox rules obtained from the rules of this ruleset and the TBox data specified. The method split the DELETE, INSERT and WHERE expressions of rules into TBox and ABox parts. Rules with only TBox parts are discarded. Rules with only ABox parts are included as is in the returned ruleset. Rules with both ABox part (in DELETE and/or INSERT expressions) and TBox part (in WHERE expression) are instead 'exploded' by computing all the possible bindings of the TBox part w.r.t. the supplied TBox data, adding to the resulting ruleset all the rules obtained by injecting those bindings. Note: this method does not modify in any way the supplied TBox data. In general, it is necessary to close it w.r.t. relevant inference rules (which can be the same rules of this ruleset) before computing the ABox ruleset. In this case, the closure should be computed manually before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        tboxData - the TBox data
        Returns:
        the resulting ruleset

      • rewriteGlobalGM

        public Ruleset rewriteGlobalGM(@Nullable
                               org.openrdf.model.URI globalGraph)
        Returns the ruleset obtained by rewriting the rules of this ruleset according to the GLOBAL graph inference mode, using the global graph URI specified. Meta-vocabulary terms are not affected.
        Parameters:
        globalGraph - the URI of the global graph where to insert new quads; if null, quads will be inserted in the default graph sesame:nil
        Returns:
        a ruleset with the rewritten rules and the same meta-vocabulary terms of this ruleset
        See Also:
        Rule.rewriteGlobalGM(URI)

      • rewriteSeparateGM

        public Ruleset rewriteSeparateGM()
        Returns the ruleset obtained by rewriting the rules of this ruleset according to the SEPARATE graph inference mode. Meta-vocabulary terms are not affected.
        Returns:
        a ruleset with the rewritten rules and the same meta-vocabulary terms of this ruleset
        See Also:
        Rule.rewriteSeparateGM()

      • rewriteStarGM

        public Ruleset rewriteStarGM(@Nullable
                             org.openrdf.model.URI globalGraph)
        Returns the ruleset obtained by rewriting the rules of this ruleset according to the STAR graph inference mode, using the global graph URI supplied. Meta-vocabulary terms are not affected.
        Parameters:
        globalGraph - the URI of the global graph whose quads are 'imported' in other graphs; if null, the default graph sesame:nil will be used
        Returns:
        a ruleset with the rewritten rules and the same meta-vocabulary terms of this ruleset
        See Also:
        Rule.rewriteStarGM(URI)

      • rewriteVariables

        public Ruleset rewriteVariables(@Nullable
                                org.openrdf.query.BindingSet bindings)
        Returns the ruleset obtained by replacing selected variables in the rules of this ruleset with the constant values dictated by the supplied bindings. Meta-vocabulary terms are not affected.
        Parameters:
        bindings - the variable = value bindings to use for rewriting rules; if null or empty, no rewriting will take place
        Returns:
        a ruleset with the rewritten rules and the same meta-vocabulary terms of this ruleset
        See Also:
        Rule.rewriteVariables(BindingSet)

      • mergeSameWhereExpr

        public Ruleset mergeSameWhereExpr()
        Returns the ruleset obtained by merging the rules in this ruleset with the same WHERE expression, priority and fixpoint flag. Meta-vocabulary terms are not affected.
        Returns:
        a ruleset with the merged rules and the same meta-vocabulary terms of this ruleset
        See Also:
        Rule.mergeSameWhereExpr(Iterable)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Two rulesets are equal if they have the same rules and meta-vocabulary terms.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        The returned hash code depends on all the rules and meta-vocabulary terms in this ruleset.
        Overrides:

      • toString

        public String toString()
        The returned string lists, on multiple lines, all the meta-vocabulary terms and rules in this ruleset.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • toRDF

        public <T extends Collection<? super org.openrdf.model.Statement>> T toRDF(T output)
        Emits the RDF serialization of the ruleset. Emitted triples are placed in the default graph.
        Parameters:
        output - the collection where to add emitted RDF statements, not null
        Returns:
        the supplied collection

      • fromRDF

        public static Ruleset fromRDF(Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Statement> model)
        Parses a ruleset from the supplied RDF statements. The method extracts all the rules and the meta-vocabulary terms defined by supplied statements, and collects them in a new ruleset.
        Parameters:
        model - the RDF statements, not null
        Returns:
        the parsed ruleset

      • fromRDF

        public static Ruleset fromRDF(String location)
        Parses a ruleset from the RDF located at the specified location. The method extracts all the rules and the meta-vocabulary terms defined in the RDF, and collects them in a new ruleset.
        Parameters:
        location - the location where to load RDF data, not null
        Returns:
        the parsed ruleset

      • merge

        public static Ruleset merge(Ruleset... rulesets)
        Merges multiple rulesets in a single ruleset. The method collects all the rules and meta-vocabulary terms in the specified rulesets, and creates a new ruleset (if necessary) containing the resulting rules and terms.
        Parameters:
        rulesets - the rulesets to merge
        Returns:
        the merged ruleset (possibly one of the input rulesets)
